title: The winners of Let It Shine are actually just ‘backing singers’ in Gary Barlow’s Take That musical
text:
Five To Five won the Take That talent show (Picture: BBC) The BBC has been accused of ‘misleading’ viewers after it was revealed that the winning band from talent show Let It Shine will only act as backing singers in the upcoming Take That musical.
The BBC show reached its dramatic finale last week – and saw quintet Five To Five win the chance to feature as a fictional group in a musical based on the music of Take That.
But the full details of the Gary Barlow-helmed show have now been revealed, and it seems that the group, comprised of AJ Bentley, Sario Solomon, Curtis T Johns, Nick Carsberg and Yazdan Qafouri, won’t be taking centre-stage after all.
Instead, the show will focus on five 16-year-old girls who are fans of the band – and The Stage reports that the winners of the BBC show won’t have any spoken lines in the production at all.
Gary Barlow judged the show alongside Dannii Minogue, Martin Kemp and Amber Riley (Picture: BBC/Matt Holyoak) The plot was first revealed during the show’s final last week , but it has come under renewed fire by both viewers and critics for being ‘misleading’, given that Let It Shine set out to find a five-piece male group for the show, which is also suggestively called The Band.
Posting on Twitter, TV critic Ian Hyland wrote: ‘So the band who won Let It Shine are not even the stars of Gary Barlow’s Take That musical? They’re the chorus line. Bad form that, BBC 1.’
So the band who won Let It Shine are not even the stars of Gary Barlow's Take That musical? They're the chorus line.
Bad form that, BBC1.
— Ian Hyland (@HylandIan) March 5, 2017 
So the #LetItShine winners aren't actually going to be the stars of the new Gary Barlow musical? Slightly misleading methinks 
— Colin Wright (@colinwright1959) March 5, 2017 

Whilst a viewer commented: ‘So the #LetItShine winners aren’t actually going to be the stars of the new Gary Barlow musical? Slightly misleading methinks.’
Another wrote: ‘Background singers? It’s not the same is it? #LetItShine should have been about getting the five girl leads.’
. @GaryBarlow & Tim Firth's The Band musical starring #FiveToFive ! Tickets go on sale 3rd April at 12 noon! pic.twitter.com/GOlaImIreA 
— Mel Giedroyc (@MelGiedroycTV) February 25, 2017 

The Band will open in Manchester on September 8 before embarking on a nationwide tour which will last until July next year, ahead of a proposed West End transfer.
However, the Beeb have since defended the casting, stating they have not misled audiences and the band will still be ‘front and centre’ of the musical.
A spokesperson for the BBC told Metro.co.uk: ‘With Let it Shine we always said we were casting for a band to appear in a musical based on the music of Take That and they had to be able to sing and dance – like a boyband.
‘The winners will sing and dance to 14 Take That numbers in Gary’s musical. We never said we were casting actors. But they will be front and centre of the musical.’
Representatives for Gary Barlow have been contacted for comment by Metro.co.uk.
